shared.sourceOrg: Northern Ireland Statistics and Research Agency

Employment rate.label: Employment rate (Northern Ireland)
Employment rate.subtitle: Percentage of people aged 16 to 64 in employment
Employment rate.longDescription: This indicator shows the percentage of people aged between 16 and 64 years in paid work or who had a job that they were temporarily away from, in Northern Ireland, for 2023.
Employment rate.caveats:
Calculation of employment rate: number of employed people aged 16 to 64 years divided by the population aged 16 to 64 years. Population is the sum of employed plus unemployed plus inactive.

Time series data is available at [NISRA](https://www.nisra.gov.uk/publications/labour-market-status-sub-population-tables).

Because the Labour Force Survey (LFS) is a sample survey, results are subject to sampling error, i.e. the actual percentage of the population in private households with a particular characteristic may differ from the percentage of the LFS sample with that characteristic.

Economically inactive.label: Economic inactivity rate (Northern Ireland)
Economically inactive.subtitle: Percentage of people aged 16 to 64 who are not in employment and are not actively seeking work
Economically inactive.longDescription: This indicator shows the percentage of people aged between 16 and 64 years who are not in employment but do not meet the internationally accepted definition of unemployment because they have not been seeking work within the last four weeks or they are unable to start work in the next two weeks, in Northern Ireland, for 2023.
Economically inactive.caveats:
Calculation of economic inactivity rate: number of economically inactive people aged 16 to 64 years divided by the population aged 16 to 64 years. Population is the sum of employed plus unemployed plus inactive.

Time series data is available at [NISRA](https://www.nisra.gov.uk/publications/labour-market-status-sub-population-tables).

Because the Labour Force Survey (LFS) is a sample survey, results are subject to sampling error, i.e. the actual percentage of the population in private households with a particular characteristic may differ from the percentage of the LFS sample with that characteristic.
